column4: hello, how is the ubuntu security thing called again (not selinux but ...)
apparmor
!selinux | kervel
i think an upgrade left me with an unusable system because of that
kde won't start saying "read only filesystem" all the time
it fails to set permissions on /tmp files
(eg dbus socket and so)
but it is definately mounted rw
what should the permissions of /tmp be ? mine are drwxrwxrwt
what is the output of 'mount'?
it says my "/" is mounted as XFS rw
can you write to it?
yeah
and when i start X it bails out saying ".X11-unix" has suspicious permissions. Then i remove .X11-unix in /tmp and x will start, then kde won't start
i'm desperate .. no errors in log, nothing in dmesg
when i try to chmod files, it says "read only file system"
but when i try to create files / remove files it works
pastebin the errors you got and the actual output of 'mount'
i can't access the net with that pc
!x > FuLio
because networkmanager won't start (because it cannot chown the dbus socket)
in general chmod won't work ... any other file operations work
copy them to a sub key or something
